name: places/ChIJd9AmI9xYwokRKN9QGb7-7co
formattedAddress: 250 Main St, New York, NY 10044, USA
adrFormatAddress: 250 Main St, New York, NY 10044, USA

editorialSummary.text: Indoor pool open daily for lap swimming, with a recreation area for kids, plus stadium seating.

originalText.text: This was the first time coming to the facility although it was nice. The lady at the front desk didn’t get her name, however me and my brother got a day pass and was told the wrong information. The gym before 6 pm is strictly basketball which we only wanted the woman tells us at 6:30pm that soccer will take place. We agree that we would pay for the 15$ since we got there around 4:45. We told the managers Philip and Yakov that the desk has misinformed us and it’s rather we keep playing or a reimbursement for the confusion with the time. Philip was highly unprofessional as he told us no and who told us this information. We tell him the front desk and he goes “there are signs up”. We explain to him this is our first time her we didn’t know. He began to argue with us. I asked for a simple apology. He then replies I didn’t say it so why would I apologize. As a manager this was the low of the low. Instead of apologizing. We became very tilted. They called security on us as I cuss him out for being a poor manager. The security followed us in the bathroom Harassing us. Then four more officers comes into the bathroom including a woman officer. Luckily I took a video. The last bit of it the “trespassed” us for their mistake.

originalText.text: Mediocre  facility that’s  accompanied by a terrible staff ; very rude and disrespectful towards my friend and I. Upon our first time there they spread misinformation about the schedule so we didn’t even get to enjoy the activity we had to pay for. I do not recommend this facility at all.

originalText.text: I like this fitness center nice location and they have all the equipment stuff and clean locker rooms

text.text: I like this fitness center nice location and they have all the equipment stuff and clean locker rooms

originalText.text: Love to go swimming here with the family on weekends. The water can be a little chilly, but for $10 for a whole family, who’s complaining? They have plenty of kick boards and pool noodles to enjoy, too, and after having had lessons at another pool, my kids have gotten better at swimming just by coming to open swim here and having fun!

text.text: Love to go swimming here with the family on weekends. The water can be a little chilly, but for $10 for a whole family, who’s complaining? They have plenty of kick boards and pool noodles to enjoy, too, and after having had lessons at another pool, my kids have gotten better at swimming just by coming to open swim here and having fun!

originalText.text:
In NYC we are so desperate fore functioning public places, especially swimming pools that I have to rate this pool five stars for being "dynamite." Here is why:
+ easily accessible by NYC Ferry
+ the facilities are dated (especially the lockers in the changing rooms), but clean and functional
+ the moderate yearly membership fee guarantees a respectful and civilized atmosphere
+ very diverse crowds including retirees and many Asian families living on Rosevelt Island
+ good etiquette when people are sharing lanes
- very limited opening hours, reopens on weekday evenings only at 7pm :(
- very limited number of courses at the in-house gym. Couldn't the gym be given to local personal trainers for free which could then use the facilities to offer some fee-based classes?
